nowadays is kernan's law so kernan's law

is that actually think about your future self when you're coming back to this or to the contributor who wants to jump

unquote law comes with an assertion which is that debugging is twice as hard and maybe it's an understatement maybe
it's 3x maybe it's four times as hard but I think we definitely spend more time debugging than writing when it
comes time to to do that and it kind of goes back to read versus write you know you write it once you read it many times

in its kind of simplest form it essentially says when a measure becomes a Target it ceases to be a good measure
and the reason I find this one really important is when you're doing consultancy work
you're often maybe like involved in in changing things changing how organizations work or building new

developers will stop working on complex code or if you're going to start saying that you know productivity is equal to
